frame.name: Bail_decision
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame covers a step in a criminal process in which a <fen>Judge</fen> decides whether the <fen>Accused</fen> should be released on bail, and, if so, what the amount of the bail should be. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Accused">Thorsen, of Grimstad, Norway</fex>, was <m>granted</m> <fex name="Status">$100,000</fex> <t>bail</t> until June 18.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Accused">He</fex> was <m>granted</m> <fex name="Status">conditional</fex> <t>bail</t> <fex name="Judge">by Teesside Magistrates</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Accused
FE.definition: <def-root>At the time of bail setting, the <fen>Accused</fen> is held without bail/bond, released on his/her own recognizance, or required to give the Court a specific amount of money for bail. <ex>Judge Duncan <t>fixed</t> <fex name="Accused">the doctor's</fex> bail at one million dollars.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Judge
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Judge</fen>, as head of the Court, determines the <fen>Accused</fen>'s bail. <ex><fex name="Judge">Judge Duncan</fex> <t>fixed</t> the doctor's bail at one million dollars.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Status
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Status</fen> idenitifies the decision made with regard to bail. The possible statuses are "without bail/bond", "on one's own recognizance", or a specific amount of money required for bail. <ex>Judge Duncan <t>fixed</t> the doctor's bail <fex name="Status">at one million dollars</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the bail setting occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the bail setting occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the bail setting which is not covered by more specific FEs, including, secondary effects (openly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Judge that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>The method used by the <fen>Judge</fen> to set the bail.
<ex>It used to be that a judge would <t>set</t> bail <fex name="Means">purely by guesswork</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The purpose for which the <fen>Judge</fen> sets bail.</def-root>
